item.title: This 1TB HP Laptop Is Now $499 Instead of $2499, Amazon Just Cut $2000 Off the Price
item.content:encoded:
Amazon skipped laptop deals during Prime Day, but it clearly saved the best for the back-to-school rush. And honestly, you don’t have to be a student to appreciate the kind of discounts popping up right now. Maybe the best deal is on this HP 15.6-inch laptop with Intel i3 processor, massive 32GB RAM, and great 1TB solid-state drive. The normal price is $2499, yet Amazon has chopped it all the way down to $499: that’s 80% off and basically one-fifth of what you’d usually pay. On top of that, it carries an impressive 4.7 out of 5 rating from buyers.

See at Amazon

Why You Should Consider Buying It

First off, the memory and storage bundle is significantly more than you’d get at this pricing: With 32GB of DDR4 RAM, you’re not bogged down with chores on a daily level. It means having dozens of tabs in your browser open, video streaming and you still have room to breathe. And then there’s the 1TB PCIe SSD. That amount of fast storage doesn’t just give loads of space for files, movies, and software — it also gets the laptop up and running in a snap.

The processor inside it is built to handle everyday needs with ease: It’s an Intel N100, capable of up to 3.4GHz when Turbo Boost kicks in. Yes, it’s not a workstation beast or a gaming processor, but for project-carrying students or remote workers with conferencing apps, it delivers. Coupled with Intel UHD Graphics, it can manage regular entertainment like Netflix or even light edit work without breaking a sweat.

The display is significant as well, and in this case, you’re getting a 15.6-inch Full HD (1920×1080) display. It’s anti-glare to make working in bright lights or in windows less stressful and its thin bezels give you more usable screen space in a footprint that’s not intimidating. At 250 nits of brightness and with 45% NTSC color, it’s aimed at comfortable streaming.

Despite the big screen and powerful internals, it weighs just 3.64 pounds and measures only 0.73 inches thick. That makes it easy to slip into a backpack or carry between classes or office meetings. The inclusion of WiFi 6E keeps you connected quickly and dependably and Bluetooth 5.3 has you pairing headphones and other peripherals effortlessly. The laptop adds a couple of ports as well: a USB-C, two USB-A, HDMI, and a headphone jack.

Plugged into Windows 11 Pro, this machine is ready for work right out of the box. You’re greeted with a bare-bones interface, Microsoft’s latest apps, and business-class features that help with security and workflow on a day-to-day basis.

All of that for $499, and you can see why this buy is so surprising.

item.title: Samsung 990 EVO Plus SSD Practically Costs Nothing, the 2TB Model Works Out Cheaper Than Buying Two 1TBs
item.content:encoded:
In need of expanding your PC storage space? Samsung is here to help with a series of SSDs at various capacities all on sale for Labor Day. The Samsung 990 EVO Plus with 1TB of space has been chopped down by 38% which brings it from $105 to just $65 — saving you $40. If 1TB isn’t enough for you, the 2TB SSD dropped 32% from $177 to just $120 — saving $57. Still not enough? Alright, alright. Well you can boost your storage space up to 4TB. This highest capacity model of the Samsung 990 EVO Plus is discounted 27% from $328 to only $240. That’s a savings of $88. Game file sizes just continue going up and up so you can set yourself up for a long while with four full terabytes.

This PC-ready SSD can keep up with all your gaming needs with its super fast read and write speeds. It can handle read speeds of up to 7,250 MB/s with writes speeds of up to 6,300 MB/s. Not just great for gamers, but if you’re someone who does any kind of high-end computing with heavy-duty workstations. Anyone working with tons of video or photo editing or is just trying to play Destiny 2 can benefit from these fast load times and vast storage space.

See at Amazon

The Samsung 990 EVO Plus SSD has a focus on high performance without sacrificing efficiency. You have the support for PCIe 4.0 x4 and PCIe 5.0 x2 to thank for that. This support leads to higher data processing and more bandwidth, all while consuming fare less power.

Not PlayStation 5 Compatible

Now you should note that this SSD does not include a heatsink built-in. You know, the tiny metal casing that’s designed to dissipate heat from the unit. Critically, that means you will be unable to install this in your PlayStation 5 to expand that consoles miniscule starting capacity. If you’re looking to pop it in your PC. you have nothing to worry about. Also, even though it’s not equipped with a heatsink, the SSD still utilized some smart thermal control. You’ll be able to really push your system without worrying about overheating the PC on account of the finely-tuned controller from Samsung. It should mean that you’ll avoid any sort of sudden drop in performance.

You can also stay on top of your SSD, keeping it up to date with the latest software and firmware updates easily. The free Magician Software can continually monitor the Samsung 990 EVO Plus SSD’s health and push updates to it periodically.

Right now, you can get the Samsung 990 EVO Plus SSD for as low as $65 through Labor Day.
